GOD.content: Unheimlichkeit of Geheimnis, both Freud & Heidegger: beyond an axiomatic of the self or the chez soi as ego cogito
GOD.linkedContent: Unheimlichkeit of Geheimnis, both Freud & Heidegger: beyond an axiomatic of the self or the chez soi as ego cogito

MONL.content: inscription of self in the forbidden language
MONL.linkedContent: inscription of self in the forbidden language

R.content: turn, turn around the self, makes a totality
R.linkedContent: turn, turn around the self, makes a totality

R.content: Derrida considers the effectiveness of Nancy’s “measuring oneself against the nothing”: 1) avoids heroism, ecstasy by substantializing nothing in plenitude 2) retains problems of the self
R.linkedContent: Derrida considers the effectiveness of Nancy’s “measuring oneself against the nothing”: 1) avoids heroism, ecstasy by substantializing nothing in plenitude 2) retains problems of the self

R.content: self finds itself infected as soon as soon as it (ipse) needs event, heteronomy
R.linkedContent: self finds itself infected as soon as soon as it (ipse) needs event, heteronomy

LOBL.content: pursue oneself by using one terror to avoid the other [neurosis?] [Abraham, more than one fidelity]
LOBL.linkedContent: pursue oneself by using one terror to avoid the other [neurosis?] [Abraham, more than one fidelity]

POO.content: “what returns to your name, to the secret of your name, is the ability to disappear in your name,” that is, not to return to itself, which is the condition of the gift (i.e. the name) of all expansion of self, of all auctoritas
POO.linkedContent: “what returns to your name, to the secret of your name, is the ability to disappear in your name,” that is, not to return to itself, which is the condition of the gift (i.e. the name) of all expansion of self, of all auctoritas

MPM.content: light of self appears in relation to death of the other
MPM.linkedContent: light of self appears in relation to death of the other

MPM.content: we come to ourselves through memory of possible mourning, knowledge older than ourselves, de Man might say: unreadability of mourning
MPM.linkedContent: we come to ourselves through memory of possible mourning, knowledge older than ourselves, de Man might say: unreadability of mourning

MPM.content: inconsolable [infinitely responsible] before finitude of memory: [want memory to be infinite?] possibility of impossible commands whole rhetoric of mourning, describes essence of memory > w/ dark light of this nothing (death of other) we learn other resists closure of our interiorizing memory [Freud’s “normal” “work of mourning” (ideally, quasi-literally devouring body/voice of other)]
MPM.linkedContent: inconsolable [infinitely responsible] before finitude of memory: [want memory to be infinite?] possibility of impossible commands whole rhetoric of mourning, describes essence of memory > w/ dark light of this nothing (death of other) we learn other resists closure of our interiorizing memory [Freud’s “normal” “work of mourning” (ideally, quasi-literally devouring body/voice of other)]

MPM.content: mimetic interiorization not just fictive, is origin of fiction, takes place in a body, makes place for body, soul, “ours” > death constitutes and makes manifest limits of me, us, obliged to harbor something greater than us w/in us
MPM.linkedContent: mimetic interiorization not just fictive, is origin of fiction, takes place in a body, makes place for body, soul, “ours” > death constitutes and makes manifest limits of me, us, obliged to harbor something greater than us w/in us

MPM.content: “I” effaces its singularity as it designates it
MPM.linkedContent: “I” effaces its singularity as it designates it

MPM.content: Paul de Man translates Hegel’s “Ich kann nicht sagen was ich (nur) meine” as ‘I cannot say I’ > effacing of I, a priori functional forgetting > “Autobiography as De-facement”
MPM.linkedContent: Paul de Man translates Hegel’s “Ich kann nicht sagen was ich (nur) meine” as ‘I cannot say I’ > effacing of I, a priori functional forgetting > “Autobiography as De-facement”

MPM.content: memory effaces remembrances—like “I” effaces itself [I forgets I at beginning of sentence]
MPM.linkedContent: memory effaces remembrances—like “I” effaces itself [I forgets I at beginning of sentence]

MPM.content: the sich, “se,” “itself,” deconstructs itself in the very act of the promise, aporetic event
MPM.linkedContent: the sich, “se,” “itself,” deconstructs itself in the very act of the promise, aporetic event

MPM.content: the sich is “promised to the effacement it promises itself” [auto-deconstruction]
MPM.linkedContent: the sich is “promised to the effacement it promises itself” [auto-deconstruction]

MPM.content: auto-deconstruction where auto-, self can’t be reflected/totalized/gathered/recollected only written and caught in trap of promise
MPM.linkedContent: auto-deconstruction where auto-, self can’t be reflected/totalized/gathered/recollected only written and caught in trap of promise

POOF.content: find friend w/in oneself (Echo before Narcissus), the other in oneself, would ruin in advance what it makes possible: narcissism & self-exemplarity [however, wouldn’t change testamentary structure Derrida is discussing]
POOF.linkedContent: find friend w/in oneself (Echo before Narcissus), the other in oneself, would ruin in advance what it makes possible: narcissism & self-exemplarity [however, wouldn’t change testamentary structure Derrida is discussing]

POOF.content: the to-come disjoins itself, disjoins the self that would yet join itself in this disjunction > to-come more ‘ancient,’ ‘older,’ than the present
POOF.linkedContent: the to-come disjoins itself, disjoins the self that would yet join itself in this disjunction > to-come more ‘ancient,’ ‘older,’ than the present

PP.content: in Laws judge must introject, internalize the letter, grammata [tou Dephikou grammatos], into his soul; anamnesic dialectics, repetition of eidos, self-knowledge, self-mastery > a forgetting of childhood, exorcism of child, teaches child to speak
PP.linkedContent: in Laws judge must introject, internalize the letter, grammata [tou Dephikou grammatos], into his soul; anamnesic dialectics, repetition of eidos, self-knowledge, self-mastery > a forgetting of childhood, exorcism of child, teaches child to speak

PAS.content: Blanchot: dying separates us endlessly from ourselves
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: dying separates us endlessly from ourselves

PAS.content: double pas, its absolute heterogeneity, deprives of nothing save its identity to self, which prevents distancing from self > double pas, absolute rarefaction w/out the least lack
PAS.linkedContent: double pas, its absolute heterogeneity, deprives of nothing save its identity to self, which prevents distancing from self > double pas, absolute rarefaction w/out the least lack

PAS.content: can one love anything other than the name? that which still lets self omit itself, so it can represent itself
PAS.linkedContent: can one love anything other than the name? that which still lets self omit itself, so it can represent itself

A.content: for Heidegger, death—stand before (steht bevor) oneself, await, precede oneself as before a mirror, as before the future, “in its ownmost potentiality for being” [see p. 78]
A.linkedContent: for Heidegger, death—stand before (steht bevor) oneself, await, precede oneself as before a mirror, as before the future, “in its ownmost potentiality for being” [see p. 78]

SH.content: “you” may be addressed to the other as well as to myself, to oneself as other [“you” listening Sagi?]
SH.linkedContent: “you” may be addressed to the other as well as to myself, to oneself as other [“you” listening Sagi?]

F.content: self does identify, to resist introjection: but only in “imaginary, occult” way; the “endocryptic identification” designed to keep topography intact and the place safe (le lieu sauf) are cryptofantasmatic, but the inclusion, divisions and partitions are real
F.linkedContent: self does identify, to resist introjection: but only in “imaginary, occult” way; the “endocryptic identification” designed to keep topography intact and the place safe (le lieu sauf) are cryptofantasmatic, but the inclusion, divisions and partitions are real

F.content: [angular] partitions [w/in Self] of crypt: fractures into angular pieces, arranges (aménage) cavities, corridors, zigzag labyrinths, anfractuosities, craggy (escarpées) fortifications > effects of breakages (cassures); requires light in darkness to shine on inner partition of splintered symbol (intrasymbolic not cosymbolic): each fragment conscious to itself, unconscious to ‘non-cry
F.linkedContent: [angular] partitions [w/in Self] of crypt: fractures into angular pieces, arranges (aménage) cavities, corridors, zigzag labyrinths, anfractuosities, craggy (escarpées) fortifications > effects of breakages (cassures); requires light in darkness to shine on inner partition of splintered symbol (intrasymbolic not cosymbolic): each fragment conscious to itself, unconscious to ‘non-cry

F.content: the Thing is encrypted by crypt (for du Moi, self’s safe) not w/in (dans) it; crypted structure of ultimate referent [Thing] means double articulation (history, story) coalesces all these genres: myth, poem, novel, drama, translation > the narrated event never appears
F.linkedContent: the Thing is encrypted by crypt (for du Moi, self’s safe) not w/in (dans) it; crypted structure of ultimate referent [Thing] means double articulation (history, story) coalesces all these genres: myth, poem, novel, drama, translation > the narrated event never appears

F.content: self: a cemetery guard (crypt is enclosed w/in self as excluded), self makes rounds (round & round) of crypt like he’s the proprietor, but he’s not, uses knowledge to keep visitors away
F.linkedContent: self: a cemetery guard (crypt is enclosed w/in self as excluded), self makes rounds (round & round) of crypt like he’s the proprietor, but he’s not, uses knowledge to keep visitors away

F.content: cryptonomy: crack (la ligne de brisure) of a symbol, upright column of name (colonne érigée d’un nom), blank voice of a scruple [see p. xiii], always extends beyond the self
F.linkedContent: cryptonomy: crack (la ligne de brisure) of a symbol, upright column of name (colonne érigée d’un nom), blank voice of a scruple [see p. xiii], always extends beyond the self

DIF.content: Heraclitean play of hen diapheron heautōi, the one differing from itself, in difference w/ itself, is lost like a trace when diapherein is determined as ontological difference?
DIF.linkedContent: Heraclitean play of hen diapheron heautōi, the one differing from itself, in difference w/ itself, is lost like a trace when diapherein is determined as ontological difference?

DPi.content: to be happy w/ happiness is to believe in it: like every belief, a belief of the other in oneself [Derrida emphasizes painful equivocality of this expression]
DPi.linkedContent: to be happy w/ happiness is to believe in it: like every belief, a belief of the other in oneself [Derrida emphasizes painful equivocality of this expression]

Gi.content: Dasein more neutral than Mensch?; Dasein’s neutrality as neutralization/subtraction of everything but naked trait of this relation to self, to the Being of its being
Gi.linkedContent: Dasein more neutral than Mensch?; Dasein’s neutrality as neutralization/subtraction of everything but naked trait of this relation to self, to the Being of its being

HLP.content: classical lying: liar knows the truth, knows he is lying, the self excludes the self-lie (the other is other enough, an enemy to be deceived in his belief)
HLP.linkedContent: classical lying: liar knows the truth, knows he is lying, the self excludes the self-lie (the other is other enough, an enemy to be deceived in his belief)

HLP.content: unless we think the other w/in oneself, an ipseity more originary than ego, a divisible ipseity, oneself as enemy
HLP.linkedContent: unless we think the other w/in oneself, an ipseity more originary than ego, a divisible ipseity, oneself as enemy

HST.content: stranger is a digression that risks corrupting proximity to self of the proper > que veut dire l’étranger?
HST.linkedContent: stranger is a digression that risks corrupting proximity to self of the proper > que veut dire l’étranger?

TN.content: se toucher toi, “Je se touche”; “tu” [in philosophical discourse] signs general/plural singularity of possible addressee, also signs possibility/need for “I” to address itself as an other > oneself: first & last other
TN.linkedContent: se toucher toi, “Je se touche”; “tu” [in philosophical discourse] signs general/plural singularity of possible addressee, also signs possibility/need for “I” to address itself as an other > oneself: first & last other

TN.content: heart: condition of desire, the effraction of the other, of what can’t return to self
TN.linkedContent: heart: condition of desire, the effraction of the other, of what can’t return to self

TN.content: diastole, absolute generosity, generosity more generous than generosity itself, orients us toward epekeina tēs ousisas, Plotinus’ One
TN.linkedContent: diastole, absolute generosity, generosity more generous than generosity itself, orients us toward epekeina tēs ousisas, Plotinus’ One

TN.content: the “self” is as indispensable as you in se toucher toi, an “I” unable to touch itself couldn't se plier à ce qui le déplie absolument, au tout autre qui, comme tout autre, habite mon coeur en étranger > no anthropological limit here > “divine,” “animal,” & life all derivative of se toucher toi
TN.linkedContent: the “self” is as indispensable as you in se toucher toi, an “I” unable to touch itself couldn't se plier à ce qui le déplie absolument, au tout autre qui, comme tout autre, habite mon coeur en étranger > no anthropological limit here > “divine,” “animal,” & life all derivative of se toucher toi

AD.content: Levinas: no nominative form of self in Latin, the irreducibility of sacrifice, law of accusative in welcome
AD.linkedContent: Levinas: no nominative form of self in Latin, the irreducibility of sacrifice, law of accusative in welcome

AD.content: “ethics beyond the political”: interruption of self (in phenomenology, by phenomenology itself), phenomenology surprises, suspends itself > paradoxical reverting to “ethics beyond the political”
AD.linkedContent: “ethics beyond the political”: interruption of self (in phenomenology, by phenomenology itself), phenomenology surprises, suspends itself > paradoxical reverting to “ethics beyond the political”

AD.content: many interruptions of self re: Sinai (broken tablets, veiling/unveiling of Moses’ face, etc.) > Sinai still provocation to think passage btwn ethical, messianic, eschatological and the political (today when the foreigner, the displaced, the refugee incur cruelty w/out precedent)
AD.linkedContent: many interruptions of self re: Sinai (broken tablets, veiling/unveiling of Moses’ face, etc.) > Sinai still provocation to think passage btwn ethical, messianic, eschatological and the political (today when the foreigner, the displaced, the refugee incur cruelty w/out precedent)

BSi.content: pitiless lucidity of cogito, triumph of conscious self-positing self, the thesis of self always reflects itself as bêtise, bêtise always triumphs > Triumph of Life in bêtise ——bêtise always on side of victor > bêtise must not find itself bête: that would be suicidal
BSi.linkedContent: pitiless lucidity of cogito, triumph of conscious self-positing self, the thesis of self always reflects itself as bêtise, bêtise always triumphs > Triumph of Life in bêtise ——bêtise always on side of victor > bêtise must not find itself bête: that would be suicidal

CIR.content: disfiguration w/out respite of Augenblick reminds you that you don’t inhabit your face, you take place in more places than you should
CIR.linkedContent: disfiguration w/out respite of Augenblick reminds you that you don’t inhabit your face, you take place in more places than you should
